info.title: Transactions API
info.description:
The Appetize Transactions API provides access to get and list order information.
Use the ListOrders endpoint to get a list of all orders to which you have access, within a date and time range that you specify.
Use the GetOrder endpoint to get order details for a specific order, using the UUID you got from the ListOrders endpoint.
We use JWT to authenticate your requests. You can generate it using the auth endpoint described below. Please contact Appetize to get the API key.

servers.description: Appetize API URL. This URL will be provided by our team.

post.description: This auth endpoint will return the JWT token required to call Transactions API.

get.description: List orders to which you have access, as defined in your JWT.
Get a specific order and its details.

put.description: Mark a quarantine order as dead letter.

get.summary: Get a List of Quarantined Orders
get.description: List quarantine orders to which you have access, as defined in your JWT.

post.description: Reprocess an order that is stored in quarantine collection.

corporate_id.description: The Corporate ID of the target transactions
corporate_id.name: corporate_id

limit.description: The max number of results to be returned
limit.name: limit

local_order_uuid.description: The order UUID of the target transaction
local_order_uuid.name: local_order_uuid

start_date.description: The lower bound for order creation date and time (UTC) to be returned
start_date.name: start_date

end_date.description: The exclusive upper bound for order creation date and time (UTC) to be returned
end_date.name: end_date

start_sync_date.description: The lower bound for order submission date and time (UTC) to be returned
start_sync_date.name: start_sync_date

end_sync_date.description: The exclusive upper bound for order submission date and time (UTC) to be returned
end_sync_date.name: end_sync_date

venue_id.description: The venue ID of the target transactions
venue_id.name: venue_id

retrieval_status.description: Current retrieval status of the order. default value is completed
retrieval_status.name: retrieval_status

status.description: Status of the quarantine order [DEADLETTER | DELETED]. Empty for orders with no status
status.name: status

amount.description: Currency amount of the discount applied multiplied by the quantity

reference.description: Connect-configured reference ID for the discount

value.description: Value of the percent or flat amount to be discounted

metadata.description: External data of the discount (no max length)

end_date.description: Date/time the transaction was created in UTC

start_date.description: Date/time the transaction was created in UTC

end_sync_date.description: Date/time the transaction was synced in UTC

start_sync_date.description: Date/time the transaction was synced in UTC

amount.description: Currency amount of the fee applied

unique_id.description: Unique identifier for the item, which may or may not be unique. Items with the same ID will be grouped together in reports

index.description: Relative position of the item in the cart, used in other references, one-based

line_item_uuid.description: Appetize-generated identifier for this item cart sale

operation.description: Indicates if this item is an item sale or an item refund

parent_item_uuid.description: Appetize-generated identifier for the parent. It is only present if the item is a modifier."

original.description: The extended price configured in Connect

sold.description: The extended price net of all adjustements, discounts, and fees

is_manual.description: Indicate if net_weight was assigned manually

kitchen_id.description: The kitchen ID associated with this item

original_order_id.description: If this is a refunded item, the original id of the order were the purchase was made

end_date.description: Date/time the transaction was created in UTC

sync_date.description: Date/time the transaction was synced in UTC

retrieval_status.description: If retrieved order has all available values or it is missing some

date.description: Date/time the transaction was quarantined in UTC

Fields.description: fields that are missing from the transaction

Errors.description: Error message from the consumer service

location.description: Identifiers for the location originating the ordere happened

local_order_id.description: The presented device order ID printed on receipts and shown in Connect

local_order_uuid.description: The order UUID of the target transaction

order_id.description: The database identity value after the order is stored in Connect

origin.description: Appetize application where this order was created"

end.description: Date/time the transaction was created in UTC

sync.description: Date/time the transaction was synced in UTC

order_type.description: The order type, as passed in from the client in the case of Ordering API, and as set in the terminal role in the case of Activate orders.

retrieval_status.description: If retrieved order has all available values or it is missing some

payment.description: Instance of a payment made on the order

amount.description: The amount of money which was paid on with this payment

change.description: The amount of money which was given back to the customer in change

tip.description: The amount of money which was given as tip

tender_id.description: Connect-configured tender id, or Connect-defined tender id if null

metadata.description: External data of the payment (no max length)

transaction_id.description: Transaction id of the payment (not in all payment methods)

tax.description: Tax assessed on an item, fee or other taxable good

amount.description: The calculated mount of tax assessed

terminal.description: Information about the terminal used during the order lifetime

user.description: Information about the users (employees) that handled the order during its lifetime

name.description: Connect-configured employee users' Name as defined in Connect

known_as.description: Connect-configured employee users' Known As name displayed on receipts

415.description: unsupported media type in content-type header
